reviews.review_msg: Daria is one of the nicest people I have ever met :) she truly cares about the well being of her students, and wants you to succeed. Participation is important, but she doesn't make you feel afraid to speak! For sure would take a course from her again.

Daria is such a great Italian Professor. She is so caring and nice and she is a true Italian so you really get taught authentically. The tests and quizzes were super fair. The final was pretty easy and it was a low maintenance course because there are no readings and you can cram before because it is basically all just memorization.

Daria is the best, most caring, most understanding prof I have ever had in my entire life (or 4 years at SFU). She goes above and beyond for her students, and is extremely understanding if in need of an extension. She genuinely wants you to "find your italian side" and is so passionate about what she teaches. Sincerely is a gem of a person!

Daria is the best teacher i've ever had at SFU. Her Italian class is fun, energetic, interesting and easy to follow. She is hilarious so she makes everything super fun and easy to learn but also makes the class that much better!! Would take her for every single class if i could! Highly reccommend:)
ADORABLE! best teacher I have ever had in SFU. I highly recommend.

She is absolutely wonderful! Genuinely cares about students and is extremely passionate about the course. A lot of activities are required, but that helps to learn the language. Make sure to go to class and participate in order to get an A. Access code purchased with the textbook is useless- don't buy. Overall, best Italian prof I have ever had!
Daria is so nice and approachable. Just don't hesitate to ask her any questions if you need help. But make sure to read the textbook before class, that's nothing to worry about.

Daria is by far one of the best professors at SFU. She is very organized, flexible and genuinely cares about her students. She is passionate and is always there if you need extra help. The material was interesting and her exams are fair. If you put in the effort, you will do well. I highly recommend doing this course with her.

Daria is arguably one of the best teachers I've had so far at SFU, and will probably be right up there by the time I graduate. She makes learning Italian fun, is very approachable, and is more than willing to help you with anything, whether it be grammar, vocab, or pronunciation. If it weren't for her, I probably wouldn't be taking 101 right now.

Daria is a wonderful prof!  She is so sweet and always willing to help you.  Very approachable, a fair marker, and super helpful when it comes to assignmentscourse work.  She told us about Italian culture and often lightened up harder classes with a funny video or a song.  I'm taking the next level of Italian because of her!

Amazing prof. Keeps the class interesting, is structured and clear, has an agenda, organized. Tolerates an appropriate amount of fooling around/talking/inattentiveness yet will politely bring your attention back if she feels necessary. Very chill-- easy to talk to, you can joke with her. Great prof, tests are normal difficulty but fair :)

She is a great teacher, with a great laugh, and a presence that fills the room. She is keen to sticking with the textbook, and will set you towards the right path in the course without being strict, negative, or harsh. A pleasure to learn from! Funny, and she has an AMAZING smile that brightens up the class.
